p.strong: Empowering all students to have the confidence to succeed!
It is our mission to build strong academic foundations and core values
that will instill confidence to be successful in an ever-changing world.

div.p: LaBarge Elementary School

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: ***Preregistration for High School***
Freshmen, sophomores and juniors,
Mrs. Clements has emailed preregistration forms for next year's classes. Please review with your parents and submit by Friday, April 24th. Thank you!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Dear BPHS Parents, Students, Staff and Friends,
As most of you are aware, our community has suffered a tragedy with the loss of one of our BPHS students. Our deepest sympathies go out to the Wing and Jones families.

You should be aware that the District has a team of counselors and administrators in place to support students and staff during this time. School staff have been informed and have been given information to assist students as we provide the necessary environment to address grief and begin the healing process. We will be asking students through their emails and through their teachers if they need or would like assistance addressing grief and begin the healing process. If you are struggling or know of a friend who is struggling please reach out to the following resources or people.

With what is going on in our school setting and being online, we need our parents and community members to be with all our children over the next several days and weeks to listen and provide guidance throughout this difficult time. We are here to help and contact information follows:
School Counselor and Social Worker- call the high school at 307-276-3324 to set up a call back or Zoom meeting or email the counselors directly.
Norma Clements- nclements@sublette9.org
Melissa Mitchell- mmitchell@sublette9.org
School Nurse-call the elementary at 307-276-3314 to set up a call back or email her directly.
Tonia Hoffman- thoffman@sublette9.org
School Resource Officer-call dispatch at 307-276-5448 or email Ryan directly
Ryan Day - rday@subso.com
Bill Lehr, Counselor 307-260-8987
Aaron Preece, Licensed Professional Counselor 307-367-2111
Trisha Scott, Licensed Professional Counselor 307-749-5004
Jackie Downie, Licensed Clinical Social Worker 307-367-4118
Other Resources
The Bill of Rights of Grieving Teens
By Teens at The Dougy Center
As grieving teens, we have the right to…

ul.li: Ask questions and have them answered honestly
Be heard and listened to without receiving unsolicited advice
Be silent and not share our thoughts and emotions out loud
Disagree with your perceptions and conclusions
Grieve in our own ways – without hurting ourselves or others
Feel all the feelings and to think all the thoughts of our own unique grief
Not have to follow the “Stages of Grief” as outlined in a high school health book
Have our own beliefs about life and death
Have irrational guilt about what we could have done to prevent the death

div.p: This Bill of Rights was developed by participating teens at The Dougy Center and does not represent “official” policies of the Center.

p.a: Helping Teens with Traumatic Grief Link

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Posted 4/7/20 @ 3:30 PM
We have added more helpful hints and tutorials for Canvas users on the E-Learning page of our website.

We are happy to report that we have received 2 new WiFi towers and they have been installed at Big Piney Elementary and LaBarge Elementary for those who are having problems with internet connectivity. We hope this will help more students connect as we go forward.
Please see our Food Service page for the latest on the Meal Program during the closure.

div.p: Posted 4/7/20 @ 3:51 PM

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Posted 4/3/20 @ 2:47 PM

Governor Gordon and State Health Officer have extended the statewide Public Health Orders through April 30. Governor also Directs 14-Day Quarantine for Travelers Arriving in Wyoming from another State or Country.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Posted 4/1/20 @ 10:07 AM
Dear Parents and Students,

On Monday, 4/6/20, as we resume school in an online environment, we will be fully staffed in each school office. If you need something from your locker/class, please call your school office on Monday to schedule a time when you can come to the front of the building to pick up the contents of your locker.
Only staff members will be allowed in the buildings, there are no exceptions. Scheduling your pick up is important.
Beginning on Tuesday, 4/14/20, we will begin accepting requests for items in gym lockers.
Thank you!

h2.div: FAMILY FIRST CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE ACT - Employee Info

For more information on Food Services or for the link to sign up for meals, please click:

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Governor Mark Gordon and State Health Officer Dr. Alexia Harrist have extended the three existing statewide health orders through April 17 to slow community transmission of coronavirus (COVID-19) and protect lives. The school closure will continue through 4/17/20.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: In accordance with the State-wide public health order issued yesterday afternoon, ALL Sublette County School District #9 (SCSD #9) Schools and facilities are closed thru Friday, April 3, 2020 (4/3/2020).

De acuerdo con el orden de la salud en todo el Estado pública emitida ayer por la tarde, todas las escuelas del Distrito del Condado de Sublette # 9 (SCSD # 9) Las escuelas y las instalaciones están cerradas a viernes, 3 de abril de, 2020 (03/04/2020).

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: SCSD #9 plans to offer a sack breakfast and a sack lunch at NO CHARGE to any enrolled student in our district that requests it during school closures, beginning Wednesday, March 25, 2020. The link below will take you to a Google form that will allow you to electronically request school meals:
School secretaries will be available via phone Monday, March 23, 2020 from 8am to 12:30pm to assist those that cannot access the form online.

SCSD # 9 planes para ofrecer un desayuno saco y una bolsa de almuerzo sin costo alguno para cualquier estudiante matriculado en nuestro distrito que lo solicite durante el cierre de escuelas, a partir del miércoles, 25 de marzo de 2020. El siguiente enlace le llevará a un formulario de Google que la voluntad que permitirá a las comidas electrónicamente la solicitud de la escuela:
Secretarias de la escuela estarán disponibles vía telefónica el lunes, 23 de de marzo de, 2020 8 de la mañana a 12:30 pm a ayudar a aquellos que no pueden acceder al formulario en línea.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Good Morning,

You should anticipate that school will be closed through April 3rd. We are preparing to make a sack breakfast and/or lunch available for our students beginning Wednesday March 25th. There will be no charge for the meals. If you want the meals for your students, we will post directions about how to obtain meals here soon, at www.sublette9.org. We will need some information from you. If you have questions prior to that date call 307-276-3322.
Buenos días,

Usted debe anticipar que la escuela estará cerrada hasta el 3 de abril. Nos estamos preparando para hacer un desayuno y / o almuerzo en bolsa disponibles para los estudiantes que comienzan el 25 de marzo Miércoles. No habrá ningún cargo para las comidas. Si desea que las comidas para sus estudiantes, vamos a publicar las direcciones acerca de cómo obtener comidas aqui pronto, en www.sublette9.org. Vamos a necesitar alguna información de usted. Si tiene alguna pregunta antes de esa fecha llamada 307-276-3322.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Yesterday morning (3/15), schools in Wyoming began closing. In the afternoon the Governor sent out a memo ‘recommending’ that all schools close until 4/3. Public Health & CDC have not made that recommendation yet. As of 3/16, we are canceling school for students on 3/23 and 3/24.

The School Board will decide at their meeting on 3/23 whether or not to follow the Governor’s recommendation. We are requesting all staff members attend meetings on Monday, 3/23. For those who have a medical issue or compromised health, we ask you not to come onsite and to stay home. Thank you!

Ayer por la mañana (3/15), las escuelas en Wyoming comenzó cierre. Por la tarde el gobernador envió un memo 'recomendar' que todas las escuelas se cierran hasta 4/3. Salud Pública y CDC no han hecho que la recomendación aún. A partir del 3/16, estamos cancelando la escuela para los estudiantes en 3/23 y 3/24.

La Junta Escolar decidirá en su reunión del 3/23 si debe o no seguir la recomendación del gobernador. Estamos pidiendo a todas las reuniones los miembros del personal asisten el lunes 3/23. Para aquellos que tienen un problema médico o de salud comprometida, le pedimos que no vengan en el lugar y quedarse en casa. ¡Gracias!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: Notice Canceling / Suspending Before and After School Activities

div.p: In response to the latest CDC guidelines and following a meeting this morning with public health and county officials, it is with sadness and regret that I am canceling/suspending ALL before and after school activities until further notice.
ALL in this case includes, but is not limited to, athletics (e.g. Track, Open Gym, etc.) Tutoring, STEM, Clubs, Prom and Performances.
We will continue to provide our Education program with as much flexibility as possible pending directives from our public health officials.
Sincerely,
Kevin P Garvey
Superintendent

h2.div: Cancelación / Suspensión de actividades antes y después de la escuela

div.p: En respuesta a las últimas directrices de los CDC y después de una reunión esta mañana con los funcionarios de salud pública y del condado, es con tristeza y pesar que estoy cancelando / suspendiendo todos antes y después de las actividades escolares hasta nuevo aviso.
Todos en este caso incluye, pero no se limita a, atletismo (por ejemplo, la pista, Open gimnasio, etc. Tutoría), tallo, STEM, Clubes, de baile y actuaciones.
Vamos a seguir para proporcionar a nuestro programa de educación con tanta flexibilidad como posibles directivas pendientes de nuestros funcionarios de salud pública.
Sinceramente,
Kevin P Garvey
Superintendente

small.em: Disclosure of directory information will be made without prior or written parental permission. Directory information, for the purposes of the school district, may include: student name, address, grade in school, date and place of birth, participation in officially recognized activities and sports, weight and height or member of athletic teams, dates of attendance, awards received, and the most recent previous school attended. Any student or parent who objects to the disclosure of directory information should provide the school with a written objection prior to the start of school or within fifteen (15) days after notification of the school's intent to make public directory information, whichever is later.

Applicants for admission and employment, students, parents, persons with disabilities, employees, and all unions or professional organizations holding collective bargaining or professional agreements with Sublette County School District Number 9 are hereby notified that this school does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, sex, gender identity, religion, reprisal and where applicable, political beliefs, marital status, familial or parental status, sexual orientation or economic status in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in, its programs and activities.

Any person having inquiries concerning the school's compliance with the regulations implementing Title II, Title VI, Title VII, Title IX, the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), or Section 504 is directed to contact the Section 504/ADA Coordinator, Superintendent of Schools or Business Manager at P.O. Box 769, 115 South Nichols St., Big Piney, WY 83113 (307) 276-3322 who has been designated by the school to coordinate efforts to comply with the regulations regarding nondiscrimination.

Persons with complaints involving harassment and/or discrimination may also contact Wyoming Department of Education Office for Civil Rights Coordinator, Hathaway Building 2nd Floor, 2300 Capitol Ave., Cheyenne, WY 82002-0050 or (307)777-7675 or for the Office for Civil Rights, Region VIII, U.S. Department of Education, Federal Building, STE 310, 1244 Speer Blvd., Denver, CO 80204-3582 or (303)844-5695 or TDD 303-844-3417.
